Mr. Patrick will enter the race Thursday morning and head to New Hampshire's State House to file paperwork to be a candidate on the primary ballot there, according...

column2: ICE grabs former Irish Republican Army terrorist in Massachusetts
column4: A onetime member of the Irish Republican Army paroled after serving time for bombing a police station in Northern Ireland decades ago has been taken into custody by ICE agents in Boston.

column2: Cowboys to be among NFL teams in attendance for Colin Kaepernick's workout
column4: Despite owner Jerry Jones' stance of mandating players stand for the anthem, the Cowboys will be in attendance for Colin Kaepernick's workout.

column2: 'We're fighting for our lives'   US apple farmers endure major crop and profit losses as climate changes
column4: Climate change is posing an existential threat to the precarious lives of farmers across the country. We've seen such dramatic, frightening crop losses," says Elizabeth Ryan, a longtime farmer in Hudson Valley, New York."

column2: FBI investigating killing of US women and children in Mexico
column4: MEXICO CITY (AP)   FBI agents are in Mexico helping investigate the fatal shootings of nine American women and children in northern Mexico last week. FBI spokeswoman Lauren Hagee said Tuesday that agents are providing assistance at the invitation of the Mexican Government." "The FBI remains committed to working alongside our international partners to help bring justice to the perpetrators of this heinous act of violence," Hagee said in a..."

column2: A solution for food waste in schools: Give it to the pigs
column4: Maine has decided that eating like a pig could be a good thing, especially for schools looking to cut down on food waste.

column2: The captain becomes a player as Tiger Woods picks himself
column4: U.S. captain Tiger Woods used one of his four wild-card selections on himself Thursday and will become the first playing captain in the Presidents Cup since Hale Irwin in the inaugural edition 25 years ago. The decision was hardly a surprise. Woods is the Masters champion and two weeks ago tied the PGA Tour record with his 82nd career victory at the Zozo Championship in Japan. He is No. 6 in the world ranking. He also took Tony Finau, U.S. Open...

column2: Prosecutor Who Asked If Sex Crime Victim Was 'Illegal' Is Fired
column4: A Houston prosecutor who reportedly asked police whether a sex crime victim was in the United States illegally has been fired, Harris County District Attorney Kim Ogg said.

column2: Trump, Erdogan to meet as thorny issues stress relations
column4: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and President Donald Trump will meet as relations between the two NATO allies are at their lowest point in decades, with Turkey rebuffing the U.S. and turning toward Russia on security issues and Ankara facing a Washington backlash over attacks on Kurdish civilians during its incursion into Syria last month.
